item.description: Notes on Wannier Functions Outline A Quick Introduction to Bloch Functions Notational Setup Periodic Hamiltonians and Bloch Functions The Problem of Finding Wannier Functions Wannier Functions and Parallel Transport Gauge Construction of Wannier Functions The Gauge Freedom Parallel Transport Gauge (IN PROGRESS) The Haldane Model (IN PROGRESS) A Quick Introduction to Bloch Functions Notational Setup \(\Lambda\) is the lattice spanned with Bravais lattice vectors \(\bm{v}_1, \bm{v}_2\): \[\Lambda = \{ n_1 \bm{v}_1 + n_2 \bm{v}_2 : n_1, n_2 \in \Z^2 \}\] \(\Lambda^*\) is the dual lattice to \(\Lambda\) spanned by \(\bm{w}_1, \bm{w}_2\) satisfying \(\bm{v}_i \cdot \bm{w}_j = 2 \pi \delta_{ij}\) \[ \Lambda^* = \{ n_1 \bm{w}_1 + n_2 \bm{w}_2 : n_1, n_2 \in \Z^2 \} \] \(\Omega = \R^2 / \Lambda\) is a fundamental cell.
